data.message: @Facebook, how about an UNDO button for your Messenger service? Or "Remove message" like Skype has?

replies.message: Thanks for sharing your ideas, Žiga. If there's something you'd like to see on Facebook, please let us know here: http://bit.ly/2cSDk5k. -Jessica

@Facebook When the inquiring person has just clearly requested what she'd like to see i.e. an UNDO button or "Remove message." Why then do you ask "if there's something you'd like to see on Facebook, please let us know" I've run into this kind of Facebook *non-answer* boilerplate response more and more often lately. http://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=http%3A%2F%2Fbit.ly%2F2cSDk5k&h=vAQEVbTh6
@Facebook I see the answer to my question/criticism above. It's in the last line in Jessica's response to Ziga's question. Excuse my error, please. (What color roses, Jessica? Red, or  white?)
